title: Avengers Cast on Premiere, Favorite Lines, Matching Tattoos & Birthday Gifts

json.text: You know, every Spring at about this time
tonight's guests drop by to share
their plans to save the world.
This year they really have their work cut out for them.
The action unfolds in "Avengers, End Game."
Please welcome Robert Downey Jr, Chris Hemsworth, Scarlett
I mean, this could be it.
This could be the last one.
This probably is the last one.
On your show? JIMMY KIMMEL: No.
Just for them, Paul, you can come back.
I feel like this is the last gathering
of the Avengers on the show.
The future's very uncertain. JIMMY KIMMEL: It is?
Oh, good. I'm glad to hear that.
You know, it was May 5, 2008 that you were here.
- Oh, wow. - Don't lie to him.
JIMMY KIMMEL: You're never coming back?
I remember Jon Favreau showing me the sketches of "Iron Man,"
and that he was working on, and thinking,
what an interesting character to start with,
you know, from the Marvel universe.
And here we are, like 21 movies later.
Have you guys seen the new movie?
Have any of you seen it?
JIMMY KIMMEL: Did you see it? - I did.
I saw it and I filmed it on my iPhone.
And I'm going to be screening it on my Instagram later.
JIMMY KIMMEL: Oh, great. ROBERT DOWNEY JR: Aw.
There's kind of a-- you know, we're not supposed to see it.
But then I'm doing an Easter screening.
Up in Malibu, the day before the premiere.
We'll have it on a loop.
This is not a-- - You guys are all invited.
This is not an open invitation.
What's the address and gate code?
Can you tell us the gate code and address?
So it will be a couple of days before the opening.
JIMMY KIMMEL: So people who come to your house,
not only will they get eggs.
They will also be able to see the "Avengers" movie.
We have to sign NDAs or do gag orders or something.
A 3 hour and 2 minute long film.
So you might only get to show it a couple of times.
Why would he show it a couple of times?
Well, he's said he's showing it on a loop.
Well, that's a long brunch. JIMMY KIMMEL: Yeah.
I mean, we can fast forward through the dumb stuff.
What is the dumb stuff? - I don't know.
Probably like, you know, your character arc.
I'll get you back for that one.
JIMMY KIMMEL: It's a three hour movie.
What's-- I know you can't reveal any of the plot details.
But what's the best time to get up and go to the bathroom?
Because you do that thing in the movies where
Is there a part that we should know?
Well, Mark said that you should wear a diaper.
And you don't have to get up.
JIMMY KIMMEL: Well, that's not a bad idea.
But you're also sitting in your own urine.
Well, that is a bad idea.
Well, not having seen the film--
I would say get one of those giant tubs of popcorn.
And then just like lower it under the seat?
JIMMY KIMMEL: Make the most of it?
In the middle of the movie, and then
you don't have to get up.
I have a scratch and sniff of Paul Rudd's face.
And by the way, it smells like me.
JIMMY KIMMEL: Scarlett, it was your idea
for what-- the original six Avengers
I thought-- well, I think Chris Evans
and I kind of came up with it. JIMMY KIMMEL: OK.
And then, but Mark does not have it.
JIMMY KIMMEL: Mark Ruffalo does not have it.
He did. JIMMY KIMMEL: Did he really?
Did you apply peer pressure to Mark?
We're not like some psycho, you know, marine squad.
Well, you did get an Avengers tattoo put on your body.
It's why he's not sitting right here.
Yeah. He would have been here.
- That's why he's been removed. - There was some--
I thought it was because he was keeps revealing the end--
Chris says he won't do press with him.
I guess he said yesterday that he's afraid of needles.
But he didn't say that before.
Just made it-- he was just-- it seemed
The Hulk is afraid of needles.
CHRIS HEMSWORTH: He's afraid of friends.
I have a dinner for schmucks tramp stamp.
Paul, of all these movies, and doing all this stuff,
What's the moment that stands out most brightly for you?
Well, there are a lot of them.
But the very first time I filmed with these guys on "Civil War,"
But that was a little bit in a bubble.
And all of a sudden I was seeing everybody in their suits.
In fact, one time Chris Evans--
And he had to run to use the bathroom or something.
And he asked the prop guy to hold his shield.
And as he walked off I just said, can I try it?
It was not dissimilar to what my character
What did you do with the shield while you had it?
I just kind of went pew, pew, pew.
Acting it out a little bit.
But then I gave it back and, you know,
tried to be a little cool.
Do any of you-- and I know this might be hard
to remember-- have a favorite line that
I had this-- when we were doing reshoots for "Iron Man 2,"
I guess my character was kind of overseeing the action
I am just bad at techie jargon.
And I had a line that went, Oracle is converging.
It was, bogie is converging on the Oracle Pavilion.
I mean, I think it got cut.
I think actually Jon Favreau is saying the line,
and I'm just mouthing the words.
we had a young kid on set who was--
who was unwell at the time and had come to visit.
And we were shooting the scene with Hulk and Thor
And it was right when I was talking to the Hulk,
and I was saying, oh, my god, it's you.
Where've you been? And da, da, da.
And he was on the sideline.
And he's like, why don't you say,
when you look up at Loki in the crowd, say,
JIMMY KIMMEL: A kid gave you that line?
A kid gave us that line. Yeah.
And it became one of the best lines of the movie.
- He used the stones again. - Hey.
We'd be going in shorthanded. You know?
Look he's still got the stones.
So let's get them, and use them to bring everyone back.
Even if there's a small chance that we can undo this,
I mean, we owe it to everyone who's not in this room to try.
If we do this, how do we know it's going to end any
Because before you didn't have me.
Hey, new girl, everybody in this room
And if you don't mind my asking, where the hell
have you been all this time?
There are a lot of other planets in the universe.
And unfortunately, they didn't have you guys.
Let's go get this son of a bitch.
That's what you need to do.
Go get that son of a bitch.
I would imagine that everyone wanted to say,
let's go get the son of a bitch.
I mean, that's the line you want.
And Chris got, let's go get that son of a bitch.
does that mean something bad for Tony Stark, for Iron Man?
On Friday you guys were all at Disneyland.
Avengers made a huge donation to children's hospitals.
And did you go on any rides while you were there?
We went on the Guardians of the Galaxy ride.
The one that drops like crazy.
We went on it. I don't know.
Where did you go? - I didn't.
Well, I was there February 7 for my kid's birthday.
We went on that ride and I almost yacked.
So I wasn't really going to do it again.
I was really-- it was good.
A couple of your people that work for you.
My team came on a bit.
I took my daughter on it a couple years ago
when it was previously called the Tower
And I was like, no. Forget this.
So I grabbed a couple of Snickers bars and things,
and slammed it in the back of her shoe under her heel.
She was like this much short, walked up,
Wildly irresponsible as well, and you're all cheering.
So I was sitting in the chair.
And this thing-- it's, you know, I don't know how many hundreds
of feet high, and whatever. SCARLETT JOHANSSON: Oh god.
We're at the top. And I'm looking at her.
And, you know, the seat is massive on her.
And I'm like, you know, we beat the system, honey.
And then it drops and she's like zoop.
She's like screaming the whole way down, like cat.
I was like, maybe there's a reason that there's a height.
JIMMY KIMMEL: Snickers bars in the shoes.
I love it. - I'm her hero.
I have to say, it's very creative.
The Snickers bars in the shoes.
That really is-- in a pinch.
Paul, you had a birthday this week.
And Robert, you had a birthday this week.
JIMMY KIMMEL: Happy birthday to both of you.
You have to be very difficult to shop for, I would imagine.
This year she got me a lovely bouquet
And then cause I'm the fourth and Paul is the sixth, I got
him a little framed art piece.
Did you like it? - I loved it.
And then I had gotten him that alpaca
that he wanted, because that's his favorite animal.
You got Paul an-- - That was--
JIMMY KIMMEL: Oh, that's nice. - He's got a bit of an attitude.
And I was so moved that I remember
I think I got you, in return--
I feel, you know, a little bad, just reciprocal,
but I got you a balloon. - That's right.
He bought her a hot air balloon.
There I am smiling back at the ground.
this year they really blew my mind.
Then we got him this super yacht,
which he-- was the one toy he-- - Oh, my god.
- And then-- - That is quite a gift.
Just to get ahead of next year, I thought-- and just--
this is a bit of a surprise to the show, I got the two
of you the Buffalo Bills. - Oh, my god.
Nobody got Chris anything, though, huh?
I think it's-- well, I'm a Chiefs fan.
But you know what? It's not a division rival.
Interesting. Nothing at all for Chris.
I got you something, Robert. Here you go.
And Hemsworth, I've like met the guy twice.
I did get you a present.
But it's like, the postal service from Australia to here
So it might have ended up--
Sounds like a damn lie to me.
And you always need tape for stuff.
They don't find it in nature in Australia.
when does the Black Widow movie starts shooting?
JIMMY KIMMEL: When does the Black
- Where when? - The one you're in.
You know, your own like movie.
And you haven't had your own movie.
But I assume you're going to have you own movie.
No. That's a lot of work.
JIMMY KIMMEL: It's too much work?
What did [INAUDIBLE] say the other day?
I was like, yeah, but everyone's talking about it.
JIMMY KIMMEL: I have a weird true story to tell you.
Last night in my haze, as I was drifting in and out of sleep,
I thought, what if Ant-Man just shrunk down
to a microscopic size and went into the veins of Thanos,
and then messed up Thanos' brain.
And then this-- today I read that there
That Ant-Man will shrink down and go into Thanos' butt.
JIMMY KIMMEL: It seems less effective.
Like how much Nyquil did you drink?
I was really losing my mind.
I am right now a little bit too.
So you guys have something special for our studio
Who would like to make this--
Chris, why don't you tell them what you have for them.
We're going to give everybody here tonight
JIMMY KIMMEL: So you guys get gifts.
Instead of-- the money I saved on your present.
So everyone in the audience, as
if you weren't going already, is going
to see the Avengers in IMAX.
The "Avengers End Game" opens in theaters, 3D and IMAX April 26.
If you liked that video, click the Subscribe button.
But only if you're ready for commitment.
